Chief/Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Company Name SCALE ai Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

Assess Threat is a machine learning and artificial intelligence company which develops analytical tools to transform manual, form-driven risk assessments into automated, data-driven risk analysis.


Mission

We help organisations better protect their people, assets, and businesses from potential threats by transforming how organisations assess and manage their most critical security and safety risks.


About the Role

We are seeking a full-time Chief/Senior Machine Learning Engineer with experience in data science, machine learning and software development. In this role, you will help us build, test, and deploy analytical tools and models to assess and forecast risk in security and safety critical areas.


You will work with, and lead, a team of Machine Learning Engineers and Research Assistants to conduct data experiments, develop trained models, test, and deploy those models to our users.


Our premier product is SCALE, which assesses terrorism risk for insurers, security companies, and risk professionals.


This is a unique opportunity to join an exciting start-up with growing traction amongst large global companies.


Skills

Software Engineering, Python, Data Visualization, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Statistics, AWS


Qualifications

We put greater emphasis on skills rather than qualifications, but the following qualifications are indicative of what candidates typically look like:

  • BSc/MSc/PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science
  • Proficiency in Python and good coding practices
  • Experience in exploratory data analysis and machine learning
  • Experience working in command-line Linux environments and hosting solutions on cloud infrastructure like AWS
  • Experience in working with Docker containers


The following skills will be highly regarded:

  • Experience working with web development technologies


Portfolio evidence of your previous work is appreciated (i.e. blog, github repository, research papers etc).


Competitive salary + equity + flexible working arrangements.

866683627:
[

Projet Communication Officer

Company Name Geoscience Australia Company Location Symonston, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Geoscience Australia provides value to Australia across a range of areas, helping to: build resource wealth, ensure community safety, secure water resources, manage marine jurisdictions, provide fundamental geographic information and maintain geoscience knowledge and capability. Effective communication with stakeholders is vital to the success of Geoscience Australia’s work across all these areas.

At times, Geoscience Australia receives dedicated funding to deliver specific programs that become enduring. Dedicated communication support is sometimes required to support these programs. One such program is Digital Earth Australia (DEA)—a world-class analysis platform for satellite imagery and other Earth observations. DEA is digital infrastructure that uses spatial data and images recorded by satellites orbiting our planet to detect physical changes across Australia in unprecedented detail. DEA prepares these vast volumes of Earth observation data and makes it available to governments and industry for easy use. This data provides a wealth of information for monitoring the environment, increasing productivity in the agriculture and mining industries, and also supports the rapidly growing market for spatial information and services.

Geoscience Australia is seeking an experienced communication officer to develop and apply creative and professional approaches to information sharing associated with DEA. You will be responsible for managing the communication requirements for DEA through a strategic and stakeholder-focussed approach, incorporating new technologies. This will include communication activities that engage government and industry sectors both nationally and internationally. \xa0To deliver communication activities and products for DEA, the successful applicant will work alongside a diverse range of professionals in Geoscience Australia—including communication strategists and advisers, event coordinators, media officers, online content managers, multimedia specialists, graphic designers, cartographers, scientists and ICT professionals.

\xa0

In this role you will:

  • Work with subject matter experts and communication professionals to develop and oversee the implementation of effective and innovative communication activities for DEA that are targeted and fit for purpose.
  • Develop, implement, and review all communication plans and activities for DEA.
  • Develop and maintain the DEA visual identity in terms of brand and communication materials.
  • Provide communication best practice advice and high-level support to internal stakeholders to ensure that communication activities meet the continuing needs of DEA.
  • Facilitate the implementation and ongoing function of the DEA Communication Advisory Team.
  • Manage DEA communication projects, as a key contact between Geoscience Australia’s science staff, other communication staff and DEA stakeholders.
  • Other duties as required, appropriate to the classification level.

866940042:
[

Testing and Commissioning Team Leader

Company Name ACCIONA Geotech Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

ABOUT US

ACCIONA is undertaking the design and construction of the civil works on the Sydney Light Rail SLR Project. The scope includes 12km of track, 19 stops, and a bridge over the Eastern Distributor, a tunnel under Moore Park, stabling and maintenance facilities, substations and other service buildings along the route.


ROLE DESCRIPTION:

In addition to ACCIONA's major civil and structural scope, ACCIONA has very critical and important scope of some systems such as Traffic control Systems (and its interface with the LRV detection system), tunnel equipment, building services (HVAC, Fire, security, low voltage). ACCIONA is seeking an experienced and talented testing and commissioning team leader with good experience in rail and complex mega projects to lead the testing and commissioning activities in accordance with the Company's contractual obligations. Our testing and commissioning team leader will report to the testing & commissioning and completion Manager and will be solely responsible for achieving the expected outcomes of the assigned testing and commissioning activities through planning, implementation, coordination reporting and data analysis on/off site.


Your duties will involve but not limited to:


  • Plan and schedule the T&C activities defining the pre-requisites and the priorities complying with project tools, stakeholders' requirements and project constraints of timing and location.

  • Providing a pivotal coordinating, communicating and interfacing role amongst many stakeholders involved in the project on/off site for tests preparation, execution and finalization.

  • Manage subcontractors to execute the test procedures as planned.

  • Check and ensure documentation received from the suppliers is in accordance with the project requirements and relevant standards.

  • Developing T&C test procedures in accordance with the project requirements

  • Perform testing activities in accordance with the project requirements and test procedures, particularly related to Traffic Control System.

  • Repot test outcomes from testing activities

  • Developing and managing T&C reporting tools of test procedures and test reports.

  • Managing, coordinating, analysing and reporting T&C data and certificates drawn from project teams, vendors and suppliers following the specific processes for approval and certification.

  • Providing a pivotal coordinating and communicating role amongst different project teams especially the site teams.

  • Chair the T&C Weekly Meeting to review requirements for T&C activities.

    REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:


  • Min 8 years' experience in a similar position in testing and commissioning preferably in rail industry or similar.

  • A Degree in Electrical or Mechanical \xa0Engineering would be advantageous

  • Traffic control systems, road signaling RMS, local Sydney experience is an advantage.

  • Good leadership skills and site control.

  • Working under pressure of critical timing and location with very constrained site conditions.

  • Good understanding to infrastructure projects specifically civil and electromechanical works.

  • Strong Analytical Skills

    \xa0

866710593:
[

Digital Product Owner

Company Name 86 400 Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 77 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

YOUR WHY

You believe that Australians need to do business with companies that genuinely put their interests first and you want to start the movement to achieve this. You are passionate about the financial services industry stepping up the value to customers and believe it starts with translating requirements into features.



The Digital Product Owner is to define and own digital app features within an agile delivery team, maximising the customer and business value of the product while focusing on speed to market.


This role reports to the Program Manager and based in Sydney CBD.


\xa0 \xa0

HOW YOU’LL SPEND 28,880 SECONDS OF YOUR 86,400

  • Understanding and translating high level business requirements and drivers from Product Managers into feature requirements

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to validate requirements and identify any assumptions, constraints and dependencies in delivering each feature

  • Ensure that all regulatory, legal and company policy requirements are considered and catered for, and that all aspects of process comply with and uphold 86 400's standards

  • Work closely with the design team to ensure business requirements are met while creating the best possible customer experience

  • Clearly express and order items in the team backlogs

  • Ensure the development team has visibility of and understands the items in the backlog and their priority

  • Support the documentation of user stories in JIRA

  • Create and maintain feature documentation, decisions and actions in Confluence, ensuring that all stakeholders are kept informed of developing requirements and solutions

  • Assist in the definition of acceptance criteria for user stories to pass

  • Sign-off user stories in each sprint and ensure UAT is conducted for each completed feature and release

  • Identify and communicate risks, issues and blockers that may require changes to scope or escalation

  • Ensure the business outcomes of all owned features are SMART and appropriately tagged and reported on

  • Participate in agile ceremonies, sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives and backlog grooming.

\xa0


WHAT MAKES YOU TICK

  • You thrive in fast paced, ever changing working environments
  • You communicate openly, quickly, transparently and clearly
  • You can effectively manage change, and assess the impact of change on requirements and impact on delivery
  • You can effectively manage conflict and issues to resolution
  • You can manage conflicting priorities quickly and effectively
  • You can easily adapt to a changing environment, and maintain a high level of personal resilience
  • You can create clarity out of ambiguity to deliver outcomes
  • You enjoy variety in your workday.\xa0


WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO 86 400

  • You have a talent for project delivery, having had at least 3 years’ experience.
  • You have some handy skills working as a Product Owner in an agile delivery team
  • You have experience in the IT/Digital area within Financial Service
  • Banking or financial services experience is a must
  • Effective communication skills, both written and oral
  • Be a team player
  • Attention to detail, with strong organisation and problem-solving skills
  • Appropriate tertiary qualification in Business studies or equivalent.

\xa0


\xa0

VALUES. EVERY SECOND

  • Customer. Customer. Customer - We put the customer’s best interests at the forefront of everything we do. We believe financial success will follow customer success.

  • Agile and Brave - Constantly collaborating in new ways to create something genuinely innovative.

  • Value Each Other - We respect everyone’s contribution, embracing a common goal and championing individuality.

  • Frank and Authentic - A high performing team who say what we mean and mean what we say to create a strong team culture.

  • Show Up - We bring our passion, positivity and sense of fun every day to embrace the challenges of changing the banking game.



This is a role for someone who is attracted to the fast pace, dynamic environment of a Fintech start up but likes the security of solid backing and a well-resourced team. \xa0\xa0A competitive package is on offer for the successful candidate.

\xa0

Visit:\xa0\xa0\xa0www.86400.com.au

\xa0

Please note: no agencies will be accepted in the recruitment of this role. We would like to take this opportunity to thank all candidates for their application. Only candidates who meet the criteria above will be contacted for an interview.
